result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Lee Spencer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***Per Court order (on the record) on 5-2-2017; defendant is eligible for SAP after serving 5 1/2 years of initial confinement whether the time is served on this case or any other case sentenced the same day.  Court also orders ALL DNA surcharges vacated and removed from each case (13CF176, 13CM214, 14CF36 & 14CF38).***
Concurrent with: to count 2

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
++Request & Order to Correct Clerical error filed 5-23-17.  Sentence was amended on 5-2-17 to one year initial confinement and ONE year extended supervision.++
****Per Court order (on the record) on 5-2-17; sentence amended to 1 year initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.****
***Per Court order (on the record) on 5-2-2017; defendant is eligible for SAP after serving 5 1/2 years of initial confinement whether the time is served on this case or any other case sentenced the same day.  Court also orders ALL DNA surcharges vacated and removed from each case (13CF176, 13CM214, 14CF36 & 14CF38).***
Defendant is not eligible for CIP.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence defendant is serving

superMiscConds.notes:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.

Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.  All prescriptions need to be approved by agent.
May not be in taverns or bars or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants and grocery stores.
Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent.
